What does the `definecurrency` command do in Verus?

The `definecurrency` command in Verus is used to define a new currency. It takes a JSON object as an argument, which specifies the properties of the new currency, such as its name, options, proof protocol, currencies it can be converted to, minimum pre-conversion amounts, and initial supply.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":97, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":[20000]'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
What does it mean when the `proofprotocol` is set to 2 (PROOF_CHAINID) in a currency definition?

When the `proofprotocol` is set to 2 (PROOF_CHAINID) in a currency definition, it means that the controller of the chain ID has the ability to mint new coins. This allows the controller to create new coins and add them to the circulating supply.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":97, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":[20000]'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
How can I mint new coins in a currency with PROOF_CHAINID proof protocol?

To mint new coins in a currency with PROOF_CHAINID proof protocol, you can use the `sendcurrency` command. You need to specify the currency, the address to receive the new coins, and the amount to mint. For example:
```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
This command mints 10,000 new coins of the "mycoin" currency and sends them to the address "mike@".

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":97, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":[20000]'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
